data.title: Hiking trails around Weisenheim am Berg
data.meta_description: Hiking trails around Weisenheim am Berg
data.text:
Length and metres of elevation: <=> 6.8 km ▲▼136 hm

Family-friendly hiking trail to the Ungeheuersee (monster lake). A tour with few, but pleasant climbs, beautiful forest passages and - not to forget - the numerous "Baenkel" along the way.

A "Baenkel" is what the Palatinate people say to a (sitting) bench. This already gives the hint to the numerous resting possibilities, which line the route from the edge of the forest to the Ungeheuersee. On pleasant forest paths you can comfortably walk at your leisure to the lake, stop there at the Palatinate Forest Association hut and or take a break at any time along the way on a "Baenkel".

We have prepared a detailed description of the route for you.

(for the English translation change languages in the top right corner of the appearing website)

Length and metres of elevation: <=> 7.9 km ▲▼140 hm

Forest circular trail from Weisenheim am Berg to Ungeheuersee (monster lake) with resting opportunities at the rest areas named after the twin communities of Weisenheim am Berg.

We have prepared a detailed route description for you.

(for the English translation change languages in the top right corner of the appearing website)

Length and metres of elevation: <=> 6.1 km ▲▼176 hm

Circular trail starting from the hiking parking lot in the Mandeltal (almond valley) through the Palatinate Forest to the Burgundy rest area. From there it is only a few metres to the natural monument Ungeheuersee (monster lake).

We have prepared a detailed route description for you.

(for the English translation change languages in the top right corner of the appearing website)

Length and metres of elevation: <=> 8 km ▲▼ 63 hm

Flat hike through the vineyards around Weisenheim am Berg, Herxheim am Berg and Dackenheim. The tour takes you first through the vines, then above the Berntal valley along the rocky edge of the nature reserve and on to the Schlossgarten (castle garden) in Herxheim am Berg next to the St. Jakob church. From here you have a great view of the Rhine plain. Continue towards Dackenheim and through the vineyards back to Weisenheim am Berg.

We have prepared a detailed route description for you.

(for the English translation change languages in the top right corner of the appearing website)

Length and metres of elevation: <=> 12.5 km ▲▼195 hm

The circular hike leads you first through the vines from Weisenheim am Berg to Bobenheim am Berg and then through the forest to the Ungeheuersee (monster lake). This high moor lake is considered a botanical jewel box due to the rare plants found here and is a popular destination for excursions all year round.

We have prepared a detailed route description for you.

(for the English translation change languages in the top right corner of the appearing website)

Length and metres of elevation: <=> 13.4 km ▲▼149 hm

The tour leads from Weisenheim am Berg along the edge of the Haardt to Leistadt without any notable climbs. Here begins the entrance to the Felsenberg/Berntal nature reserve. You will cross the valley incision, passing orchard meadows and limestone formations on a natural path. Via the Riesling hiking trail you come to Kallstadt. From here you hike to Herxheim am Berg. You can take a rest under old trees with a great view in the Schlossgarten (castle garden) next to the St. Jakob church. The way back goes above the Berntal valley - past the Neolithic cave - and through the vineyards to Weisenheim am Berg.

We have prepared a detailed route description for you.

(for the English translation change languages in the top right corner of the appearing website)

Length and metres of elevation: <=> 14 km ▲▼334 hm

Attractive tour with inclines via Weisenheim´s round trip 3 to the Ungeheuersee (monster lake), then a section via the "Ganerbenweg", past natural monuments such as "Krumholzer Stuhl" (an ancient quarry), the "Kanapée" (an ancient hermitage) and Teufelsmauer (devil´s wall). The way out of the forest leads along the hiking trail "Sieben Waldwunder" (Seven Wonders of the Forest) via "Liebesbriefkasten (love letter box) and the "Portemonnaie" (wallet) down to Leistadt. Via the "Weidenhof" it then goes through the vines back to Weisenheim am Berg with beautiful views into the Berntal valley and the Rhine plain.

We have prepared a detailed route description for you.

(for the English translation change languages in the top right corner of the appearing website)

Length and metres of elevation: <=> 17 km ▲▼224 hm

From Weisenheim am Berg, the tour leads through Bobenheim am Berg and then uphill to Battenberg. From Battenberg you can enjoy magnificent views of the Rhine plain. The trail continues through the forest back down to neighbouring Kleinkarlbach. From here you hike along the Eckbach brook past various mills to Kirchheim. Afterwards, the trail leads you through the Golfgarten Deutsche Weinstraße (golf course) and the village of Dackenheim and further through the vineyards back to Weisenheim am Berg.

We have prepared a detailed route description for you.

(for the English translation change languages in the top right corner of the appearing website)

Length and metres of elevation: <=> 17.9 km ▲▼176 hm

Varied hiking tour through the vineyards and various villages in our holiday region, as well as through the valley incision of the Felsenberg/Berntal nature reserve with its scattered fruit meadows and limestone cliffs.

We have prepared a detailed route description for you.

(for the English translation change languages in the top right corner of the appearing website)
